description.narrative: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: a) Farmers: The Project is expected to improve access to a reliable off-take market for a significant number of smallholder farmers while increasing their productivity and supporting their shift toward greater commercialization. b) Employees: The Company's expansion is expected to create over 2,500 jobs directly and potentially twice as many jobs would be created along with the value chain, contributing to skill building and non-farm employment. A high share of employment created in the dairy sector tends to be at the bottom of pyramid (BOP). c) Consumers: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute both to improving the food safety and food security through expanding access to quality affordable dairy products.

The proposed project involves IFC investing debt in an INR equivalent of approximately US$ 15 million in Dodla Dairy Limited (Dodla or the Company). The proposed investment will support Dodla to: (a) expand and upgrade its existing manufacturing infrastructure by purchasing new equipment for select processing plants; (b) fund its working capital needs; and (c) for general corporate purposes including marketing and brand building (the Project). Update February 2021: IFC committed INR 1,000 million (approximately US$15 million) to Dodla on February 02, 2021 by way of subscription to equity shares of the Company to support the general capital expenditure and working capital requirements of the Company.. The investment has been committed from two projects, INR 500 million committed from project #42009, and an approximately equivalent amount from project #44940.
